Legal_Issue: Whether the Immigration Program Manager improperly refused to consider new evidence and breached procedural fairness
Procedural_Stage: Judicial review after reconsideration request was denied
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant failed to submit updated documents due to reliance on outdated instructions; officer refused to consider new evidence despite awareness of old kit usage
Decision_Outcome: Refusal of application due to failure to meet adaptability points
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate eligibility and reason for late submission
Credibility_Factor: Applicant's reliance on outdated application kit considered credible context
Legal_Rule: Officers have discretion to reconsider decisions if new evidence is provided; procedural fairness requires consideration of unique circumstances
Procedural_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness in refusing to consider new evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Improper refusal to consider new evidence, breach of procedural fairness
Outcome_on_Merits: Not decided on merits; case remitted for reconsideration
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Breach found: officer failed to provide fair opportunity to present case
Key_Evidence_Considered: Outdated application kit, applicant's explanation for delay, failure to meet adaptability criteria
Legal_Framework: Administrative law, immigration law, procedural fairness
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged refusal to consider new evidence and lack of procedural fairness
Defendant_Response: Maintained refusal based on non-compliance with submission requirements
Remedy_Requested: Reconsideration of application with new evidence
Outcome: Case remitted for reconsideration by an immigration officer
Legal_Provision: Sections under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act regarding reconsideration and procedural fairness
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet adaptability points due to incomplete documentation
Governing_Rule: Procedural fairness, statutory discretion under IRPA
